meanings.sent1: The cataphoretic solution moved the particles towards the negative electrode.
meanings.sent2: The cataphoretic process is commonly used in electrophoresis.
meanings.sent3: The cataphoretic gel seemed to have a mind of its own, guiding the particles effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was cataphoretic, always directing the team towards success.
meanings.sent5: The cataphoretic effect was so strong that it almost seemed magical.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the movement of charged particles in an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The cataphoretic motion of the particles was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: In the experiment, the cataphoretic particles were attracted to the positively charged plate.
meanings.sent3: The cataphoretic dance of the particles in the electric field was like a synchronized performance.
meanings.sent4: The cataphoretic behavior of the ions resembled a choreographed ballet.
meanings.sent5: The cataphoretic movement of the charged particles was like a graceful ballet in the electric field.

meanings.definition: Having the property of carrying particles in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The cataphoretic material guided the particles precisely where they needed to go.
meanings.sent2: The cataphoretic substance ensured the particles moved in a specific direction.
meanings.sent3: The cataphoretic conveyor belt transported the particles with ease.
meanings.sent4: The cataphoretic pathway led the particles straight to their destination.
meanings.sent5: The cataphoretic property of the material directed the particles like a compass.
